(Engine)
20221001-20230101
20230101-99999999
(Vegas)
Please new create date config.
ex: configuration_2023.xml

*<DFD>*
{code:java}
      <dataFieldDescriptor code="NumberOfDays" type="Text" mandatory="true" elementLinkType="net.ifao.vegas.domain.expense.StringLink" elementLinkRole="expense.numberOfDays">
        <assignTo>
          <assign type="${CLASS_Receipt}" displayOrder="2">
            <gui>
              <dataFieldGUI guiType="FREE_TEXT" />
            </gui>
            <validation>
              <regEx expression="[0-9]*" />
            </validation>
          </assign>
        </assignTo>
        <nameTranslation>
          <name locale="en_US">Number of days</name>
          <name locale="fr_FR">Number of days</name>
        </nameTranslation>
        <descriptionTranslation>
           <name locale="en_US">Number of days</name>
           <name locale="fr_FR">Number of days</name>
         </descriptionTranslation>
        <roles>
          <canEdit name="ExpenseStatementOwner" />
          <canEdit name="ExpenseArranger" />
          <canSee name="ExpenseApproverRestricted" />
          <canSee name="ExpenseApproverFinal" />
          <canEdit name="ExpenseAuditor" />
          <canSee name="ExpenseAccountant" />
          <canSee name="ExportProcess" />
          <canSee name="ExpenseManager" />
          <canSee name="ExpenseAdministrator" />
        </roles>
      </dataFieldDescriptor> {code}
Receipts
"expense.basereceipt.receipt.hotel"
"expense.basereceipt.receipt.continental.breakfast.on_bill"
"expense.basereceipt.receipt.continental.breakfast.out_bill"

<Validation rule>
Receipts > "hotel bill" and "Breakfast out of the bill"
                   *{color:#ff0000}"Breakfast on the bill" >No need validation rule{color}*

*Hotel Bill*
Validation rule> The cap defined for the couple (country, city) for the receipt type HOTEL * number of days entered. If the calculated amount is lower than the entered amount or the converted amount => No error message – When the calculated amount is higher => One error message has to be displayed
             
Sample: maximum limit(CAPS_AT country) of 110 EUR X 6 nights.
Lower 660EUR> No error message
Higher 660EUR > get the error message

CAPS:
[https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/EXP/repos/engine-configs/browse/CalculationConfiguration/ama-de-continental/fr/default/20221001-99990101/calculation.properties]

!image-2022-11-18-14-26-37-789.png!

*Breakfast out of the bill*
Validation rule: The fixed cap defined for the receipt type BREAKFAST OUT OF THE BILL * number of days entered. If the calculated amount is lower than the entered amount or the converted amount => No error message – When the calculated amount is higher => One error message has to be displayed

Sample: maximum limit of 11 EUR X 6 nights.
Lower 66EUR> No error message
Higher 66EUR > get the error message

CAPS:
[https://repository.secure.ifao.net:7443/projects/EXP/repos/engine-configs/browse/CalculationConfiguration/ama-de-continental/fr/default/20221001-99990101/calculation.properties]

!image-2022-11-18-14-27-50-028.png|width=491,height=144!

Error message:
Hotel Bill > still use stoed error message
Breakfast out of the bill > New error message
       EN>"The limit cap is exceeded, maximum amount is 11 euros per day"
       FR> "Le plafond limite est dépassé, le montant maximum est de 11 euros par jour"

Best regards,
Yutaka

column1: Rheinmetall / adjust existing approval validation calculation
column27:
Dear colleagues,

the issue was investigated with https://jira.ifao.net/browse/ITE-1080 (shortened outcome under the examples below)
{color:#ff0000}Please implement{color}
 * {color:#ff0000}first on {color}Bali for all locations  
 * {color:#ff0000}THEN ONLY FOR TEST LOCATION{color}
Rheinmetall AG Teststandort on {color:#ff0000}PROD{color}
 *  
 * {color:#ff0000}after testing and customers approval: {color}for all other locations on production

{color:#ff0000}the following{color}:
 * customer wants to compare non reimbursable amount vs. total amount of the statement 
 * {color:#ff0000}if there is a reimbursement{color}:
deviation percentage between non reimbursable amount and total amount of the statement must be calculated as shown in the calculation example below and:
 ** if deviation is less or equal to 10%:
approval must be skipped
 ** if deviation is higher than 10%:
approval must be triggered

{color:#ff0000}calculation examples:{color}

{color:#ff0000}*8839237*{color}
*!image-2022-11-11-16-30-31-749.png|width=744,height=368!!image-2022-11-11-16-31-31-561.png|width=833,height=283!*
*!image-2022-11-11-17-12-36-847.png|width=531,height=229!*
*Reimbursement amount = 94,40 EUR*

*Calculation as expected by customer:*
{*}total statement amount ({*}{*}all receipts, itineraries, per diems...{*}{*}) = 672,07 EUR{*}
compared to
*non reimbursable amount = 577,67 EUR*
deviation is about 14%:

*(577,67*100) / 672,07 = 85,95%*
*100% - 85,95% = 14% deviation* 
*=> approval must be triggert because deviation is higher that 10%*
{color:#ff0000}
*8868133*{color}

!image-2022-11-11-17-48-41-272.png|width=719,height=349!

!image-2022-11-11-17-50-24-873.png|width=642,height=270!

!image-2022-11-11-17-52-03-989.png|width=546,height=217!

*Reimbursement amount = 457,86 EUR*

*Calculation as expected by customer:*
{*}total statement amount ({*}{*}all receipts, itineraries, per diems...{*}{*}) = 2.963,94 EUR{*}
compared to
*non reimbursable amount = 2506,08 EUR*
deviation is about 15%:

*(2506,08*100) / 2963,94 = 84,55%*
*100 - 84,55 = 15% deviation* 
*=> approval must be triggert because deviation is higher that 10%*

Outcome of ITE-1080:

+*Error as reported:*+
Customer complains that Expense Statements skipped approval despite the max. deviation of 10% was exceeded.

+*Root Cause:*+
There are two things applying for this ticket
1. There is a misunderstanding on customer side. 
As confirmed internally, the calculation was not done in the way they provide in the documentation:
We never compared the non-reimbursable amounts against the total amounts, but we compared the booking amounts against the total amounts.

2. There is a small inconsistency in the used code: We get all the receipts and check if they have booking information. If this is the case we get the amount. However, we have scenarios that result in multiple receipt types in Expense, but referencing the same booking code. This means, for some cases, we get the same booking amount multiple times which results in cumulated booking amount that is higher than the real booking amount and Statements skip Approval due to this.

+*Solution:*+
If they want to calculate differently to the current means of calculation and use the method they provided in their example above, this will make calculation easier and avoid issues coming from root cause

Reply

16/Mar/23 5:30 PM;askarja;Hi [~jtkacz],

unfortunately now a part of the old workflow is missing. 
The only thing that should be changed was the calculation when a booking has to be sent to 1. level approver.

Workflow as it was (and should be further):
 * {color:#172b4d}if there is a reimbursement{color}:
deviation percentage between non reimbursable amount and total amount of the statement must be calculated as shown in the calculation example below and:
 ** if deviation is less or equal to 10%:
approval must be skipped
 ** if deviation is higher than 10%:
approval must be triggered

*{color:#de350b}The next step does no longer work correctly:{color}*
 * after 1. level approval
 ** if the {color:#de350b}total {color}amount {color:#de350b}of the statement{color} is {color:#de350b}lower than 2500 EUR{color} it must be sent {color:#de350b}directly to audit{color}
 ** if the {color:#de350b}total {color}amount {color:#de350b}of the statement is 2500 EUR or higher{color} it must be sent to{color:#de350b} 2. level approver{color}

It was tested with #11242400: the total of this statement is below 2500 EUR but was sent to 2. level approval, what is wrong.

Can you please fix it?

Thank you in advance and best regards,

Annette

 ;;;
column265:
03/Apr/23 11:52 AM;askarja;Hello [~jtkacz],

Below you find the workflow that has been implemented so far, confirmed by Filip.
{color:#de350b}The only thing that should be changed is the way HOW to calculate the 10% deviation.{color}
{color:#de350b}The rest of the workflow should remain as before.{color}

Sorry for the confusion I caused.

Best regards,

Annette



if there is a reimbursement:
 * if deviation percentage between non reimbursable amount and total amount of the statement is less or equal to 10%:
 ** If the Difference exceeds 2500 EUR - Approval restricted YES, Approval final YES
 ** If the Difference less than 2500 EUR - Approval restricted NO, Approval final NO

 * if deviation is higher than 10%:
 ** If the Difference exceeds 2500 EUR - Approval restricted YES, Approval final YES
 ** If the Difference less than 2500 EUR - Approval restricted YES, Approval final NO

 * Exception: Single day trips without perdiems - less than 100 EUR (No approval):
 ** receipt types types to be checked 
"expense.basereceipt.receipt.rheinmetall.taxi"
"expense.basereceipt.receipt.rheinmetall.petrol"
"expense.basereceipt.receipt.ticket.rheinmetall.public.transportation"
"expense.basereceipt.receipt.car.private"
"expense.basereceipt.receipt.rheinmetall.parking"

 * 
 ** if any other receipt exists the first level Approver is triggered ;;;

column1: Traton - adjust private accomodation
column27:
Dear colleagues,

please adjust the {color:#ff0000}private accomodation in EMS {color}with the following values:

{color:#ff0000}{{AMOUNT: 20,00 Euro for all trips and countrys}}{color}
{color:#ff0000}{{G/L account: 47600}}{color}
{color:#ff0000}{{cost center comes directly from the trip}}{color}

{color:#ff0000}analogous to solution recommedation{color} of Martin Rohkamm from ITE-1194:{*}{{*}}

+*Issue as reported:*+ In the TRATON system private accommodation is selectable in the travel itinerary, but on calculate a validation error is raised

*Root Cause:*

Caused by invalid configuration.

1) Vegas (UI) is displaying at all traton locations the private accommodation type because of the ce-configs setting:

!image-2022-11-11-14-51-18-878.png|width=1250,height=341!

 

2) The accommodation type is set in the test locations, but *no allowance* is configured (country settings below):

!image-2022-11-11-14-52-48-338.png|width=1100,height=576!

 

3) In all other Prod TRATON locations the accommodation block is present, but completely blank (meaning no allowed accommodations for calculation are present in the engine):

!image-2022-11-11-14-54-13-072.png|width=1169,height=540!

 

The result is a validation error - stating that the accommodation type private is not allowed.

+*Solution:*+

Configure the EMS setting for "private" accommodation as type + the allowances per country or for "ALL" 




Thank you in advance and best regards,

Annette

I'm reopening this ticket because I spoke with the customer today and the implementation is not 100% correct.

The good news is that for domestic trips, within Italy, the limits for the receipt types are correct and the warning message is displayed properly. The issue is with international trips (outside of Italy).

The implementation done on ticket CI-7458 is also applying to trips, where if in the country field (next to the date) in a receipt type, it is a country other than Italy there should be no limits and no warning message. For these 9 receipt types, there should be no limit and no warning message:

|Meals (Breakfast) |
|Meals (Lunch) |
|Meals (Dinner) |
|Meals expenses (supplier)- lunch|

|Business entertainment expenses (customers)|
|Business entertainment expenses (suppliers)|

Wanted behaviour: If user selects country that is not Italy (international travel), for the above receipt types, there should be no limit and no warning message.

column1: INEOS - Update the GST to 8%
column27:
Dear Team,

 

Please update the GST to 8% from January 1st 2023 for Singapore location.

Please don't remove the current GST (7%) before January 31th.

During January 2023 both rates have to cohabit.

 

Please let me know if you have any question about it.

 

Thank you.

column265:
19/Dec/22 2:24 PM;mstaszek;Hello [~ssanz] :)
I was approached by [~spinelli] and I put some clarification I will add it below.
If you still need any clarification let codebusters know, I will be till next week.

Thank you!

{*}DS{*}:
*Customer received this response n the IR:  "Today it's not possible to mix to period configuration in a same statement so we have two solution.*
*The first one is to add the 8% GST also in the config before 01.01.2023 and in this case the calculation will possible.*
*Or if you don't want that we can change the error message to be more clear."*

 

*Does this mean that it is possible to add the 8% in 2022 and then there will no longer be an error?* 

 

*For example, if I book my ticket in December 2022 for a trip in January then there will be no issues with the different tax values in the same expense claim - correct?* 

 

*And then I assume the tax values will be automatically appended right? (Receipt from December 7% then from January on 8%)*

 

So, the case is that depending on first popup when you create expense statement, this configuration on UI side will be loaded (available fields, visible tax rates on receipt etc.)

But for calculation purpose there is also separate configuration on engine side (so all things that are done after calculate button is clicked)

And this configuration depends on dates of selected expense statement elements (receipt, absences)

 

*DS: Does this mean that it is possible to add the 8% in 2022 and then there will no longer be an error?*

 

Customer want new tax rate 8% to be available from 01.01.2023

If I allow new tax rate to be used with older configuration period (on engine side), when you select in first popup good configuration (on UI side after 31.12.2022) you will see new available tax rates, but nothing stop you from creating receipts and absences with date before 01.01.2023(on engine side). This way you are able to calculate statements and put wrong tax rate 8% with older receipts and absences (before 2023).

There is also a setting (on engine side) that allow to calculate between periods (if you have some of receipts or absences in 2022 and 2023 in one expense statement) it will apply the oldest configuration to whole calculation.

so there are 3 way how to handle:

 

1) leave as it is now - not possible to calculate with new 8% before 2023 and quite vague error message (we can't the text)

2) allow new tax rate 8% to be used with configuration before 2023 (on engine side) -> if this is done whole calculation is performed with old period settings) there is no error but possibility that some user use wrong tax rate in 2022

3) turn off multiple period calculation (on system level) and there is different error saying that claculation between periods is forbidden (we can't change the text) -> it will block all statements from calculation when in one statement there are elements in 2022 and 2023



And the question to customer is what is the way they want to proceed.

 

I hope this is clear now !https://statics.teams.cdn.office.net/evergreen-assets/personal-expressions/v2/assets/emoticons/smile/default/30_f.png?v=v81|width=20!;;;
column266:
20/Dec/22 3:20 AM;dspinelli;Thanks a lot [~mstaszek]  very clear - just one point I am not so clear on.

If we select option 1, we are on the 10th of January 2023, and I claim an expense from  28DEC22-5JAN23  - I have receipts for both 2022 and 2023 - Does this mean each receipt will be automatically appended with the correct tax or will I have to manually select the 7% for my 2022 receipt and the 8% for my 2023 receipt

Many thanks!

Delphine;;;

It will be brought to the board next Wednesday;;;
column260:
09/Nov/22 4:14 PM;agheorghe;Dear all,

We have discussed the topic in the board.

Our understanding of the requirement was that the customer has 0% for B0 for Hotel and all countries, but would like for specific countries in the export only to overwrite with B7 tax key while maintaining 0% in the UI.

This most probably depending on the country corresponds to a certain tax rate % different than 0 since they are claiming they can ask for the money back and the customer requested for the shortcut. They are requesting to show something to all actors in the workflow while in the export in the posting to be different.

First of all, this requirement is achievable in Vegas by mapping for each country for Hotel the corresponding tax rate (e.g. 9%, 15%, etc.) and tax key B7, but of course it demands considerable effort as it means to map a different tax rate and tax key per 35 countries.

e.g.

Hotel 7 %- B7 Belgium

Hotel 5% - B7 France

Our approach at the time has been that we do not allow any foreign rates and if we do it will be up to 7rates/ 7 countries therefore from our point of view, this request should have been rejected from the start as we do not support with foreign VAT reclaim within Cytric itself and tell the customer to go to VAT specialists for such claims.

Therefore if they are not willing to wait for the product enhancement I mentioned previously and again below, they need to go through a partner to help them with VAT foreign reclaim, you may want to check what are the options with our current VAT partner.

At this stage, the board does *not* endorse any custom logic as it is a bad practice.

Please be aware that in terms of the product enhancement [EXPENG-1006|https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fjira.ifao.net%2Fbrowse%2FEXPENG-1006&data=05%7C01%7C%7C80943bd17407428202eb08dac095aa5d%7Cb3f4f7c272ce4192aba4d6c7719b5766%7C0%7C0%7C638034046289054979%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=qGgqMDlQga2nMUG6Hy4cdBh1chHAFQXXATxzwUPoKvA%3D&reserved=0] that will come in next PI6, first iteration, it implies to be able to overwrite a tax key only, no tax rate, for a certain receipt in specific countries so it will respond to their requirement as we were able to understand it.

Hope this clarifies.

I remain at your disposal shall you have any further questions.;;;

column1: Continental -  Update customelogic and system text
column27:
Hello team,

Could you please update the customelogic.

1)  Allow for multiple Similar Receipts
In the case of an Air Ticket, calculation is permitted if there is a receipt of the same amount on the same day.


{code:java}
          <typeName code="expense.basereceipt.receipt.ticket.flight">
            <name locale="en_US">Air ticket</name>
            <name locale="fr_FR">Voy/Depl Avion</name>
          </typeName>
{code}

2) Remove Caps rate for receipt of "Office supplies (Home Office)"
Currently, it is set to generate a verification error if it exceeds 250 EUR.
Customer would like to remove the current rules about the validation date and the amount and change the information message which is currently displayed.

System text
{code:java}
          <item value="expenseStatement.receipts.general.expense.basereceipt.receipt.continental.office.supplies.home.office">
            <name locale="fr_FR">Le montant maximum à saisir et à rembourser est de 50% de la facture avec un plafond défini (cf mail RH). Cumul des factures sur une seule NDF.</name>
            <name locale="en_US">The max entered amount to claim is 50% of the invoice within max defined by HR dept. All tickets must be in one sole Travel Expense document.</name>
          </item>
        </values>
{code}

Best regards,
Yutaka

column1: PORSCHE - New locations
column27:
Dear Team,

[~ssanz] is on vacation, please contact me ([~skarja]) if you have open questions.

 

As part of the "PACE" project at PAG Germany, PORSCHE needs 2 new locations on Staging and Production as a test environment.

Unfortunately they have to start with their tests at the beginning of September and need the {color:#de350b}_locations on Staging latest on September 2nd._{color}

Please note that {color:#4c9aff}*apart from the* {color}*{color:#4c9aff}blueprint{color}*, *{color:#de350b}different G/L accounts apply{color}* here, which are shown in one of the {color:#57d9a3}*attached files (3 spreadsheets!!!):*{color}
 * {color:#172b4d}labels and header translated EN  -> file "labels translated_ Kontierung-Cytric Expense PACE" {color}
 * labels and {color:#172b4d}headers{color} DE  -> original file "Kontierung-Cytric Expense PACE"

 

*{color:#57d9a3}Please orientate{color}* yourself{color:#57d9a3} *in* *all 3 spreadsheets*{color} (config key Dienstreise, config key Sammelabrechnung, cost types) in each cas{color:#172b4d}e{color} {color:#57d9a3}*on the column "Account (PACE)**"*{color}.

 

{color:#de350b}*Please change also Tax Keys:*{color}

0% USt        old = VN;            NEW: 40
 7% USt        old = V2;             NEW: 46
 19% USt       old = V9;           NEW: 45

 

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Thank you in advance and best regards,

Annette

column1: ÖBB - Accomodation must not be paid if there is a hotel receipt
column27:
Dear Team,

ÖBB complains because in the statement #8391002 there is an Hotel receipt and also a accomodation have been payed while the behaviour wants that if there is an hotel receipt (to be reimbursed or already paid by company), the accomodation should not be paid, it is one or the other but not both.

Please could you verify and fixed this issue?

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra

Hi Sandra,

 

I see that Grzegorz already provided a delivery date, it will be delivered by product beginning of October.

 

We are literally talking of 1 1/5 2 weeks, please explain to the customer that they are waiting for a solution that will be embedded in the product and they are not going to pay for it as a SR since will be a product enhancement.

column258:
30/Aug/22 1:52 PM;fkazmierczak;Hello [~skarja],

in all export configuration files (all entities) the following piece of code is used:

 !faulty_first_absence.png|thumbnail! to get the first Absence. The code is faulty because the service doesn't order absences by date by default, hence the random Absence can be taken as the first one.

The mentioned code should be rather replaced with:

 !corrected_code.png|thumbnail! where function *getAbsencesOrderedByDate* orders the Absences the way it is needed to get the real first Absence.

Please ask the Customer to let us implement the change in one of the testing location - I would suggest *RWM DE Teststandort* and Customer should test it then. After positive feedback the same change should be applied in all of the locations.

Thank you in advance! ;)
;;;

column1: Vaillant - setup two new checkboxes
column27:
Dear Team,

Please could you set up only for German Location two new checkboxes with following message:

Checkbox 1 / German:

Hiermit bestätige ich, dass es sich bei dieser Reisekostenabrechnung nicht um eine Betriebsveranstaltung, eine Bewirtung von Mitarbeitern oder ein Incentive handelt.

Checkbox 1 / English:

I hereby confirm that this travel expense statement is not related to a company event, entertainment / hospitality of employees or an incentive.

Checkbox 2 / German:

Hiermit bestätige ich, dass diese Reisekostenabrechnung mind. einen der o.g. Aufwendungen umfasst und dies bereits im Rahmen des Meldeprozesses an HR gemeldet wurde.

Checkbox 2 / English:

I hereby confirm that this travel expense statement is related to at least one of above-mentioned expenses which have already been reported in the scope of reporting process to HR department.

 

And if the user does not select one of the two checkboxes, the expense statement should not be sent for approval and it will have the following error message:

Error message / German:

Bitte geben Sie an, ob diese Reisekostenabrechnung Aufwendungen enthält, die der Personalabteilung gemeldet werden müssen.

Error message / English:

Please select, if this travel expense statement contains expenses which have to be reported to HR department.

 

Please implement this two checkboxes in the box in red shown in the screenshot below.

!image-2022-08-10-12-41-31-942.png!

 

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra

Could you do that ?

Please only for the Location Porsche AG and in staging system.

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra

column258:
23/Aug/22 12:04 PM;ssanz;Hi [~dykiert], it is working but when a user filled in not only country but also region the field in the export is not filled in properly: eg. Country: Spain / Region: Palma de Mallorca -> in the export the field is filled with "ES-IB" instead of "ES". Is it possible that also when there is the region shown in the statement only the country is filled in the export? Thank you. BR,, Sandra

 ;;;
column259: 24/Aug/22 7:30 AM;ddykiert;Hi [~ssanz], I can cut this String to the first two letters and then you have only the country code. Do you want me to do this in position of the actual field? In this case you won't see the chosen region or should I create an new field for this?;;;
column260:
26/Aug/22 2:10 AM;askarja;Hi [~dykiert],

I substitute Sandra during her vacation, can we have a call to clarify your question?

Steffi Egener (CSM of Porsche) sent this question already to Expense Q&A chat, maybe the information of Martin helps?

Best regards,

Annette

"Hi General, I received following question from my client Porsche: If field "region" is filled in a statement than there is no uniques value for "country" like "FR" or "ES" in the export - it is shown like "ES-IB". As they would need to have the country code for absence in the export: do you know if there is a solution like e.g. hidden FDF or something else which can provide a country code in the export even region is filled? Thanks and regards Steffi

 

!image-2022-08-26-02-11-43-400.png!  

 [12.07 08:47] Martin ROHKAMM

Please talk to codebusters - they can provide an extra field with the first 2 characters from the AbsenceLocation field in the Export - it is fully adaptable (if the customer himself is not able to do a simple substring() operation)

​[12.07 08:48] Martin ROHKAMM

And this is no error - this is exactly how the default export interface is designed;;;

the case was updated by the customer with the following corrections / todos (partially marked in green in the screenshot:

 * name of the field "Trip Purpose" should appear in German ("Reisegrund")
 * warnings should appear for "Holding" companies, all other companies without warnings

 

If it is not clear for (for me it isn't) which ones the Holding locations are I will return the question to Gül Sabab.

Annette;;;
column259:
03/Aug/22 11:13 AM;fkazmierczak;Hello [~skarja]:

1. The FDF is added on the system level to affect all locations (instead of copying this FDF to all locations which would make the maintenance more problematic). I can change the display order so that this FDF will be displayed as the last one. Keep in mind it is only visible by the Admin and Auditor.
2. Ok, I will change it.
3. What kind of warnings are meant here and what "Holding" companies mean?

Thank you for the feedback!;;;
column262:
12/Aug/22 4:51 PM;askarja;Hi [~fkazmierczak],

unfortunately the changes were not implemented properly.
I attached Gül's documentation (auditors_for all locations) with missing requirements.

Best regards,

Annette;;;
column263:
17/Aug/22 11:36 AM;fkazmierczak;Hello [~skarja] again,

the requested changes were provided. 
FYI the problem with displaying FDFs in exact order as Rheinmetall requests is the result of the fact that some FDF were initially added in the System level and some of them in the location level. The correspondence between the levels is sometimes hard to fix. The solution for this would be to copy all system FDFs to all locations one by one. However, it would dramatically increase the maintenance effort in future (all FDFs would have to be separately updated / changed at the location level instead of one change at the system level).
FYI2 In the screenshots attached by Guel I can see some of the Expense Statements were created in the past (even in July) before our changes have been deployed. That is the reason why some FDFs are missing or wrongly (from the perspective of new config) displayed and it can happen to all ES started before the date of changes.
All new Expense Statements (created after our changes are done) should use the updated configuration.

I hope that is clear, if not please let me know ;);;;

column1: Aquila Capital - Expense issue with export and change request
column27:
Aquila Capital has requested a change / addition in the process of automated file exports from Expense to a sftp server. Actually the processed cases in Expense were referring to 4 different mandant IDs. The generated files are exported to an ftp server of Aquila; the mandant ID is the name of a destination folder on the ftp server and also this ID is a key value in the metadata files for DATEV Imports (“EXTF_*.csv”) .

*The change request is, that now new Mandants will be processed, so we need to add them to the list of possible mandant IDs.*

They had one example that could not be processed because of a missing ID: The already known IDs with a destination folder are: (see file 1)

Usually the ID is reflected in a specific value in a CSV File: (see file 2)

Today there was the attempt to create an export for a former not used ID ({{10223}}) and the ID was missing, but the files and the csv-files were exported to the ftp server (into the destination folder 11306) : (see file 3)

There is no Mandant ID in the (line 1, row 12) of the csv file, so it cannot be processed automaticallyThe question is: How can we activate additional Mandant IDs in Cytric or do we just have to add the corresponding folder on the FTP server? (see file 4)


*IN ADDITION*  there is an encoding problem in the CSV-Files that Aquila is receiving: In the second line, which is part of the DATEV mandatory header, there is a special digit with UTF-8 encoding.
The following lines are added for each position (accounting information). Whenever a special character appears, the encoding seems to be ANSI, so either the header or the accounting lines have bad formatted special characters.

With UTF-8 encoding: (see file 5)

With ANSI encoding: (see file 6)

column1: VW - Splitting of approval for expense statements
column27:
CARIAD is currently working on a change request regarding the expense approval functionality.

They have implemented an approval workflow which directly assigns an approver to a certain cost-center for every expense statement.
Because of the growing number of expense statements they would like to split it up and change the approval process so:

1. Regular travel expense statements do not need approval anymore (e.g. train, flight, hotel...)
2. Hospitality statements do need approval (e.g. restaurants...)

Is there the possibility to implement it like that?
column198:
server: travel
system: Volkswagen-CSO
location: CARIAD
column257: 09/Jun/22 8:51 AM;pwenner;Due Date missed, WeekTriage label added;;;
column258:
13/Jun/22 12:03 PM;djagodzki;Hi [~aklabisz] ,
To progress with this ticket I will need additional info.

There is now way of telling which Expense Statement is related to hospitality or regular travel. Maybe the customer meant that, the *RECEIPTS* on the Expense Statements are considered Hospitality receipts and Regular travel receipts? Please do clarify that and let me know :)


*How current workflow works (from description):* approval workflow directly assigns an approver to a certain cost-center for every expense statement.

*Modification*: should the workflow now *+stop+* assigning an approver to expense statements *+that contain only+* Regular travel +*RECEIPTS*+? Is this the desired behavior after the change?

*Receipts*: I will need a list of RECEIPTS that the customer considers Regular travel and hospitality. If Expense statement contains only receipts from this Regular travel list, then, with a new workflow, this expense statement wouldn't need approval.

Thanks!;;;
column259:
29/Jun/22 11:31 AM;nsanchezruiz;hi i asked client

waiting feedback;;;
column260:
02/Aug/22 8:36 AM;nsanchezruiz;[~djagodzki]

 

reply from client:

1) We consider only two receipt types as hospitality:
- Hospitality expenses (Drinks) (internal/external)
- Hospitality expenses (Food) (internal/external)

2) The desired behaviour after change is:
- IF expense statement contains hospitality receipts: Approval workflow as currently implemented necessary
- IF expense statement contains all other receipt types (like Hotel, Train, Flight and so on): No approval workflow needed → skip approval step and directly route it to "Audit"

Can you please provide us an update how long the change will take to be implemented?;;;
column261:
29/Aug/22 3:04 PM;djagodzki;Hi, [~nsanchez],
Changes are live on BALI and ready to test.;;;

30/Aug/22 11:56 AM;nsanchezruiz;[~djagodzki]

approval must go only if hospitality receipts chosen

so if only perdiem and not hospitality receipts included then it should skip approval

client advise: {color:#de350b}PRODUCTION ONLY ON 15 SEP{color};;;
column263:
15/Sep/22 10:40 AM;askarja;Hello [~djagodzki],

just checked the TMS setting for Expense Approval flow on Cariad system in production, which explains the "Approval workflow as currently implemented":

!image-2022-09-15-10-30-45-050.png|width=477,height=139!

 

so summary is:

only basic approval flow before Auditing is triggered, if a statement contains (no matter if also flight / hotel... is content of the statement)

For all other statements the approval flow will be skipped.

Cheers, Annette;;;
